result.execSummary:
The defendant Andre L Green was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to 22CF458
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program if revoked.  Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
No contact with Home Depot in the City of Waukesha, Target in the City of Waukesha, Walmart in the Village of Pewaukee or any other merchant listed in the Criminal Complaints in cases 22CF114, 22CF563 or 22CF781.

Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.  Complete a Thinking for a Change Course.  Obtain full time employment (35 hours per week) within the first 30 days of release to Extended Supervision.

Pay restitution ordered in 22CF458 and 22CF114 as a condition of Extended Supervision/Probation.  Operate a motor vehicle only with a valid driver's license.  Become involved with AA or NA within 30 days of release to Extended Supervision/Probation, attend a minimum of 2 meetings per week and obtain a sponsor within the first 60 days of becoming involved in the program.  No new law violations.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
Restitution for Home Depot in City of Waukesha.
Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision/Probation.
